## useAsyncDataEffect() function

Fetches data from an API and then updates a `useState` setter

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function useAsyncDataEffect<T>(getData: () => Promise<T>, options: {
    stateName: string;
    otherStatesToMonitor?: unknown[];
    setter: (arg: T) => void;
}): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  getData | () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt; | callback that returns a promise which resolves to data |
|  options | { stateName: string; otherStatesToMonitor?: unknown\[\]; setter: (arg: T) =&gt; void; } | options having to do with <code>useState</code> and <code>useEffect</code> |

<b>Returns:</b>

void

## Example

An example of how to use this with `React.useState`

```ts
const messages = React.useState<IMessage[]>();
useAsyncDataEffect(() => getChannelMessages(channel.teamId, channel.id), {
  setter: setMessages,
  stateName: "messages",
  otherStatesToMonitor: [channel],
});

```
